snippet: Mr. Trump’s opponents hope his latest provocation may be too much for well-mannered voters in heavily evangelical Christian South Carolina to bear.
abstract: Donald J Trump's use of profanity to describe Sen Ted Cruz polarizes Republican Party, largely along class lines, as more affluent Republican view such language as ill-suited for highest public office in nation.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and MAGGIE HABERMAN
byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin reported from Charleston, and Maggie Haberman from New York. Trip Gabriel contributed reporting from Tampa, Fla.; Jeremy W. Peters from Myrtle Beach, S.C.; and Matt Flegenheimer from Greenville, S.C.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump’s opponents hope his latest provocation may be too much for well-mannered voters in heavily evangelical Christian South Carolina to bear.

headline.main: With a Slur for Ted Cruz, Donald Trump Further Splits Voters
headline.print_headline: With a Slur for Cruz, Trump Further Splits Voters
